133.title: p. 34 in The Comics Journal, no. 189
133.author: [No author]

134.heading: Italian Comics Publishers--Miscellanea.
134.title: "Obscenity Conviction of Italian Comics Publisher Overturned"
134.author: by Michael Dean
134.appears_in: p. 13 in The Comics Journal, no. 233 (May 2001).
notes: Begins: "After being sentenced to a month in jail and a 2,000,000-lire fine for publishing Miguel Martin's disturbing graphic album, Psychopathia Sexualis, in Italy, Edizione Topolin owner Jorge Vacca was exonerated in March by the Italian Supreme Court."

135.heading: Italian Countryside.
135.title: "Vampires Fly at Dusk!"
135.author: story by Archie Goodwin ; art by Reed Crandall
135.appears_in: p. 16-21 in Creepy, no. 1 (1964) ; reprinted in Creepy, the Classic Years (New York : Harris Publications, 1991).
notes: "Italian countryside plagued by the curse of the undead."

136.heading: "The Italian Cousin."
136.title: Celebration
136.author: edited by Jennifer Camper.

contents.author: Joan Hilty
contents.title: "You must not read Gabriel García Márquez after the breakup"

notes: "Comix for discerning homosexuals, uppity ladies, fierce people of color and all their friends."

137.heading: Italian Design Valvoline.
137.title: Feux
137.author: Mattotti.
notes: Translated from Italian to French by Gabrielle Borile.

138.title: "The Italian Difference"
138.author: by Howard Simpson
notes: Color-illustrated survey of current Italian comics.

139.title: "Italian Disney Comics Artist Romano Scarpa Dies at 77"
139.author: Stefano Priarone
139.appears_in: p. 46-47 in The Comics Journal, no. 269 (July 2005).
notes: Scarpa died April 23, 2005. Item is followed by a list by David Gerstein of Scarpa's work in American Disney comics.

140.title: "Italian Doonesbury, Dark Knight Translator Killed in Iraq"
140.author: Stefano Priarone and staff
140.appears_in: p. 33 in The Comics Journal, no. 264 (Nov./Dec. 2004).
notes: Enzo Baldoni was a kidnapped journalist.

141.heading: Italian Fanzines.
141.title: "Contarino in Italy?"
141.author: Cloudio Piocinini
141.appears_in: p. 77 in Comic Book Marketplace, no. 17 (Sept. 1992).
notes: Letter from Italian fanzine MSN, asking permission to reprint an article.

142.heading: Italian Food.
142.title: "What is the Most Beautiful Language?"
142.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Hagar savors the words: "Lasagna, Pizza, Spaghetti, Al dente, Primavera, Manicotti."

143.heading: Italian Food.
143.title: "The Wheat from the Chaff"
143.author: Gilbert Shelton
143.appears_in: 1 p. in Yellow Dog, v. 2, no. 2 (no. 9/10) (Apr. 1, 1969).
notes: Starts with Fat Freddy cooking a meal of Italian food, and ends with him giving two policemen the Official Junior Peaceman Salute.

144.heading: Italian Food.
144.title: "This Restaurant Has It All"
144.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The kids want Mexican, Italian and Chinese food, and the restaurant they choose is called "The Great Melting Pot."

145.heading: Italian Food.
145.title: "With a Little Grated Cheese"
145.author: Mike Peters.
notes: Summary: Mother Goose asks Grimmy how he likes Italian shoes.

146.heading: Italian Food.
146.title: "You Just Can't Get a Decent Scungili or Calamari at Happy Stan's Foodery"
146.author: by Mark Tatulli.
notes: Summary: Mrs. Angelini is going to South Philly in preparation for a church dinner.
